description: Ms. codex. Manuscript erroneously foliated beginning on the front flyleaf. Record follows erroneous foliation. Title from leaf 2b, line 11. Physical description: 17 lines per page; written in naskh in black on tan glazed, laid European paper. Rubrication and catchwords; marginal notes. Mild staining and a few paper repairs. Origin: Rajab 1102 H [April 1691], by Sulyamān ibn Shāh Sulaymān al-Ḥasanī al-Ḥusaynī Ṭabāṭabāʼī (leaf 206a). Incipit: الحمد لله المتفرد بالقدم والدوام المتنزه عن مشابهة الاعراض والاجسام
author: Ibn al-Muṭahhar al-Ḥillī, al-Ḥasan ibn Yūsuf, 1250-1325
extent: 205 leaves : paper ; 231 x 151 (165 x 78) mm bound to 231 x 154 mm
provenance: On leaf 206a, two owners' notes; one is accompanied by a stamp and the other is dated 1120 H [1708 or 1709].
